replies: (‚ÄúThoughts and prayers‚Äù is reference to the NRA‚Äôs phrase used to deflect conversation away from policy change during tragedies. Not directed to PM Ardern, who I greatly admire.)

No its a widely used term in response to a tragedy. It has nothing to do with the NRA.

I've heard folks say "Sending thoughts & prayers your way" since before I knew who the NRA were. Sometimes when bad things happen to people far away, I feel helpless. Only thing I feel like I can do to possibly help is to get on my knees & pray for folks affected.

Thoughts & prayers are fine, especially when you feel it's all you can do & your faith is important to you; I'm not religious, but I get that.

But when that's all people in positions of power or influence offer (NRA ), it's not enough, it's not fair, and it's irresponsible.
